alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Jefferson; Milwaukee; Ozaukee; Sheboygan; Washington; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 7:57PM CST until February 18 at 8:30PM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST FOR OZAUKEE...NORTHWESTERN MILWAUKEE...NORTHERN WAUKESHA...WASHINGTON... NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN DODGE AND SOUTH CENTRAL SHEBOYGAN COUNTIES... At 756 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Saukville to 6 miles north of Palmyra, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 45 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstates 94, 41 and 43. Locations impacted include... Northern Milwaukee, Waukesha, Wauwatosa, New Berlin, Brookfield, Menomonee Falls, West Bend, Mequon, Hartford, Pewaukee, Brown Deer, Grafton, Cedarburg, Port Washington, Sussex, Hartland, Delafield, Jackson, Fox Point and Elm Grove. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Dodge; Jefferson; Milwaukee; Ozaukee; Sheboygan; Washington; Waukesha
